Description: Fragment of the corner of a furnishing textile; decoration in undyed linen and purple wool loops; the lower part of the textile is decorated with a purple undualting line with dots on either side; c.5cm above this is a right angle motif and the end of another of this is on the right of the textile; above these is the lower part of a circular motif; all edges cut and ragged; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/18), weft-undyed linen (S/8); supplementry weft loops-undyed linen (S/3mm-3cm long), purple wool (Z/twisted/c.8mm long), one line of loops every 5 picks
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
